alert.note: Alert for Coastal Charlotte; Coastal Lee; DeSoto; Hardee; Highlands; Inland Charlotte; Inland Lee; Inland Manatee; Inland Sarasota (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 5:46PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Highlands, southern Hardee, southeastern Manatee, Charlotte, DeSoto, Lee and southeastern Sarasota Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 545 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Lake Istokpoga to 8 miles southwest of Venus to 7 miles southwest of Felda. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cape Coral, Fort Myers, North Port, Punta Gorda, Arcadia, Lake Placid, Lehigh Acres, Port Charlotte, Lake Istokpoga, Palmona Park, Southwest Florida Airport, Lochmoor Waterway Estates, Babcock Webb Wma, Babcock Ranch, Pine Manor, Olga, Venus, Buckingham, Villas and Sylvan Shores. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
